title: Market Tour, Tasting of 35 Fruits, and 4-Course Peruvian Cooking Class in Lima
description: Forge a deeper connection to the culinary culture of Peru during a cooking class and market tour that gives you the chance to taste 35 different varieties of fruit. You’ll explore a market with a guide and overcome the language barrier while discovering exotic ingredients you may not have seen before.
all_descriptions: Forge a deeper connection to the culinary culture of Peru during a cooking class and market tour that gives you the chance to taste 35 different varieties of fruit. You’ll explore a market with a guide and overcome the language barrier while discovering exotic ingredients you may not have seen before.

ItineraryYou meet our guide at the entrance of the centrally located Surquillo Market Nro 1. For about 50 minutes, you walk through the market and hear about all the exotic fruits, vegetables, legumes, herbs, meats, fish and seafood, herbs, quinoa varieties and discover little known pants, roots, and seeds from the Andes. Get detailed explanations to all the different produce and get to know the little stands and vendors we get our produce from.

Mercado Nº 1 de Surquillo, VXJF+MPH, Surquillo 15047, PeruMain entrance of market "Mercado 1 de Surquillo", at intersection of highway "Paseo de la republica" with bus station "Ricardo Palma".

Location: https://goo.gl/maps/G5w6chwEQBGcFEwX9

If you use uber search for "Mercado 1 de Surquillo" 
There are Surquillo markets 2, 3…7. Be sure to go to number 1!
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.
provider:
Google. Google disclaims all warranties, express or implied, with respect to translations, including any warranties of accuracy, reliability, and any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and freedom from forgery.

Ahavea Tase, and so should you

Jan 2025 • Solo
This is one of two best inexpensive eats with common fare with friendly staff. Located on the back of the Fagatogo Fruit Market in downtown Pago Pago American Samoa, No indoor seating but on a tropical Island why stay indoors. Just really a few steps from the harbor view to enjoy with the meal.

Lizzy S-T
Pleasanton, CA13 contributions

What an amazing experience our son found for us at TripAdvisor! Highly recommend!

What an amazing experience our son found for us at TripAdvisor! This wasn't just a cooking class; it was a deep dive into local culture and history, including a fascinating "market tour", "fruits test" and a four-course cooking session. The level of detail and engagement was truly impressive. Christian, our instructor, was exceptionally informative and clearly had a wealth of knowledge to share. We were also struck by how clean and well-organized the kitchen was. The lesson itself was perfectly structured, and the dishes we prepared were absolutely delicious – even for us, who cook a lot at home, every single dish was new and exciting! We highly recommend it.
Written July 3, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Daniele Uboldi
Monza, Italy47 contributions

How to learn about Peruvian food

Sensational experience! Everything was organized in detail thanks to the care of Christian, Yurac and Maritza. You can see the passion with which they have been carrying on the business for over 10 years.
Christian's knowledge of the market was really satisfying, he gave us a lot of information about all sorts of customs.
The cooking class is fantastic, you prepare the dishes step by step and then consume them just ready. Really all delicious, get ready because you eat really much!

South Bend, IN51 contributions

Excellent experience; worth the money!

May 2025 • Friends
I’m 90 miles from Chicago & sure wish SkyKitchen was in this area of the US. This cooking class was excellent!!! Christian & his staff are professional, patient, gave us interesting info (including some history) about Peruvian foods. There were many steps in our 4-course meal & Instructions were clear. Food was delicious, & we made it ourselves! I had pisco sours elsewhere in Peru & NONE were as good as the one he should us how to make. Definitely worth the money for this experience.

Market tour, 35 fruit tasting and 4-course Peruvian cooking class in Lima

The tour was super fun, from shopping in the market, with various curiosities and explanations, to the tasting of fruits that he had never experienced and, most importantly, the preparation of the dishes, made in a simple and fun way. The cordiality and charisma of Jurac and Christian are also the highlight of the experience.

Anne Marie Z
Plattsburgh, NY9 contributions

From Non cooker to Peruvian Meal

Mar 2025 • Friends
As cooking is not high on my priority list Chef Yurac made it easy. He took my friend and I to the market to pick up some ingredients, then back to his roof top kitchen where he gave us a taste test of a variety of fruits , which included 6 different types of bananas, then commenced to guide us thru preparing and cooking a 4 course Peruvian Meal to include cocktail and desert! Wonderful experience was had and he even sent us the recipes by email, great cooking and eating experience

Nora B
Beaconsfield, UK22 contributions

Christian helped me create the most amazing food ever

Nov 2024 • Solo
Christian is a lovely fellow, excellent cook, and a patient and inspiring teacher. We had a fun visit to the local market where he taught me all about Peruvian produce and chose fruit and fish for our meal. Then we spent the rest of the morning in his fresh, cosy rooftop kitchen along with his able assistant Marta and another couple of clients. We made the most amazing food, I've never produced anything as good. The only problem was there was so much I couldn't eat it all. He also provides you with a link to recipes so you can try your skills at home. I'm going to attempt it with my son in law who's very enthusiastic to try Peruvian cuisine.

Sign up for cooking with Christian at SkyKitchen, you'll be glad you did!. Try to do it at the beginning of your Peru trip so you can better appreciate all the other meals you'll eat while you're there, Peruvian cuisine is great.
Written December 2, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
